title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.3: CHILD PROTECTION IN HUMANITA

description.narrative: Vulnerable children in humanitarian settings, especially CAFAAG, UASC, displaced children and survivors of SGBV, are monitored and benefit from a package of child protection services., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable children in humanitarian settings, especially CAFAAG, UASC, displaced children and survivors of SGBV, are monitored andbenefit from a package of child protection services.

description.narrative: In a context where the scale and complexity of protection concerns continued to be alarming, UNICEF ensured continued assistance, protection and care for 3,074 children released from armed groups, 2,616 unaccompanied and separated minors, while scaling up GBV prevention, response and risk mitigation interventions which reached 152,051 women and children. Through the establishment of static and mobile child friendly spaces, UNICEF provided support to 127,718 children affected by conflicts, natural hazards such as the Nyiragongo Volcano eruption, Ebola outbreaks in Beni and Butembo. Measures to prevent, report and respond to SEA were included across all UNICEF supported interventions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2021
